Rude, rude, rude. Normally you are greeted with a smile and hello in Thailand but they didn't even respond when we said Hi to the staff.
Ordered drinks and went to sit down, they didn't bring the drinks over to us, we had to go and get them when our order was shouted out. Was going to order food but decided not to. Really weird vibe, feels unfriendly and run down when U walk in too.

Staff were barking at people who forgot to take their shoes off. Very, very unfriendly.

We had to ask for mats to sit on as otherwise you had to sit on dirty chairs or the ground, they then brought them out from behind the bar? No use them being back there!

Almost no signage and very steep and dangerous road up there.

100% will never recommend.

View is good though...but you have to pay for it!

reviews.author: Tim Hante
reviews.content:
(Translated by Google) We were looking for a nice place to watch the sunset and luckily we found the Three Sixty through the reviews.
Without them we would certainly never have come here. The arrival is not easy, as it is very steep uphill. The scooter almost reaches its limits. Downhill (in the dark) it's fun again ;)
Once at the top you will be rewarded with a great view of the evening sun. There are a few seats directly in front on a kind of terrace or anywhere else in the bar. You can chill out on comfortable seat/lounge cushions, listen to music and have a few drinks/cocktails.
Food is also offered, but we didn't try it, so we can't say anything about it.
A special highlight is definitely a small pool, from which you can also watch the sunset. So pack your swimming trunks!

Oben angekommen wird man mit einem mega Blick auf die Abendsonne belohnt. Es gibt einige Pl√§tze direkt vorne auf einer Art Terrasse bzw. sonst √ºberall in der Bar. Es l√§sst sich gem√ºtlich auf bequemen Sitz-/Liegekissen chillen, Musik h√∂ren und ein paar Getr√§nke/Cocktails zu sich nehmen.
Essen wird ebenfalls angeboten, welches wir aber nicht probiert haben und daher nichts dazu sagen k√∂nnen.
Ein besonderes Highlight ist mit Sicherheit ein kleiner Pool, von dem aus sich ebenfalls der Sonnenuntergang gut beobachten l√§sst. Also, packt die Badehose ein!

As its name suggests, it is a bar or restaurant located on a hill overlooking the surrounding scenery. In the evening, you can watch the beauty of the setting sun or the sea on a cloudless day. And when the night comes, you will be able to enjoy the atmosphere of the sea decorated or colored with lights from fishing boats or squid boats all over the sea floor. And taste seafood or a la carte food that you want to eat.. It's a place worth visiting once if you visit Koh Phangan.

reviews.author: Dmitry S.
reviews.content:
I recently visited the 420 Club and I must say, I was blown away by the stunning views from the mountain top. The panoramic vistas of Koh Ma and the surrounding sea scenery were simply breathtaking. It was a truly unforgettable experience to take in the natural beauty of the area while enjoying a drink or a meal.

The location of the 420 Club is awesome overall, with its mountain top position offering a unique perspective of the island. However, due to its popularity, it can get quite busy during sunset times. So if you're looking to enjoy the sunset from this amazing spot, be prepared to jostle for a good view among the crowd.

That said, the food and drinks at the 420 Club were excellent, and the service was friendly. And of course, the stunning views were the perfect accompaniment to the dining experience.

Overall, I highly recommend a visit to the 420 Club. The incredible mountain top views of Koh Ma and the surrounding sea scenery, combined with excellent food and drinks, make for a truly memorable experience. Just be aware that it may be busy during the sunset times, but it's definitely worth the wait for the views.

reviews.author: Anna GALVAN
reviews.content:
(Translated by Google) Roof top bar with the best views of Mae Haad Bay and Komah Islet and a breathtaking sunset. In addition, if you come across an evening with a DJ, you will have the very heterogeneous atmosphere that goes with it: tourists of all stripes and even young children. Only downside, an entry fee of 200 ThB. Inside, something to have a drink and eat: skewers, fruit and other fried foods, at tourist prices. Outdoor music ends at 9 p.m. so as not to disturb the sleep of the neighborhood. Afterwards, the sequel is improvised in a kind of garage where it's hot and the music resounds. Bring flashlights if you plan to walk down. A shortcut will leave you at the bottom of Mae Haad, opposite the Family Mart. If you're on a scooter, don't abuse the Chang, the dirt road isn't lit... Worth seeing at least once.

(Original)

En plus, si vous tombez sur une soir√©e avec DJ, vous aurez l'ambiance tr√®s h√©t√©roclite  qui va avec : touristes de tout poil et m√™me des enfants en bas √¢ge. Seul b√©mol, un droit d'entr√©e √† 200 ThB. A l'int√©rieur, de quoi prendre un coup et se restaurer : des brochettes, des fruits et autres fritures, √† des prix touristiques. La musique en plein air se termine √† 21h pour ne pas perturber le sommeil du quartier. Apr√®s, la suite s'improvise dans une sorte de garage o√π il fait chaud et la musique r√©sonne. Pr√©voyez des lampes torches si vous comptez descendre √† pied. Un raccourci vous laissera en bas de Mae Haad, en face du Family Mart. Si vous √™tes en scooter, n'abusez pas de la Chang, le chemin en terre n'est pas √©clair√©... A voir au moins une fois.

Come as recommended. Viewpoint on Koh Phangan. I can't say that I can't come. There are many ways to come in. If you follow Google, you will have to turn a lot. You can enter UTOPIA. The road is much more comfortable. I use a City car with S gear and I can still go up comfortably.

There is parking for both motorbikes and cars. Most foreigners use motorcycles or more. Or you can use the shuttle service of that accommodation.

There are both food and drinks, especially food that tastes not bad. I ordered a seafood salad to try. At first I thought it was on the hill. It must not be delicious, but when you eat it, the taste is very good. As for the seafood, both shrimp and squid are also very fresh.

The drink is ordered as a coconut, but the texture is a bit too hard.
I forgot to tell you that I ordered at the Counter bar and paid for it first.
